intro: Pachypleurum linearilobum, commonly known as the slender-lobed pachypleurum, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated, and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a pinkish hue, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
